intro: Trigonia villosa var. villosa, commonly known as the woolly trigonia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, or villose, stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
